comment.narrative: In 2010 55,610 criminal cases were reported to police only 666 were prosecuted in court 547 SGBV cases backlogged in 2011

description.narrative: Credible elections for Parliamentary seats and support to the Parliament has provided an opportunity for MPs effectively realize their mandates towards the peaceful resolution of ethnic differences and lessening of traditional tribal animosities.

The Support to Parliament project aims to strengthen the capacity of parliament to effectively carry out its legislative, representative and oversight functions as well as perform its central role of ensuring reconciliation and securing lasting peace for
capital of a political entity
Elections - elections

Number of parliamentary assistance and assistance coordination offices operational , number of constituency outreach undertaken by MPs Number of MP capacity building completed and number of parliamentary assistance coordination offices operational

comment.narrative: A new Parliament in place with 70% first timers; standing Order (SO) does not reflect the changes in the management of the Parliament 70% of MPs have no parliamentary experience

description.narrative: Preventive Development Support on Disaster Risk Management

The project aimed at strengthening the policy framework and institutional arrangements for managing natural resources and addressing land tenure, climate change, disaster, and environmental management.
independent political entity
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

 National Training Action plan developed and validated  Institutions, Mechanisms and Capacities strengthened for rapid responses to national disasters at all levels  Review and integrate Guidelines on International Disaster Relief into national DRM policy and action plan  Conduct Risks and vulnerability profiles for selected districts

comment.narrative: Disaster preparedness, risk reduction and response strategies are integrated into national development planning

- Cabinet approved Land Policy - Development of a Position Paper on NRM and environmental sustainability for the Constitutional Review process - Domestication of the Natural Resource Charter Benchmarking Precepts - Development of the National Position Paper and participation in UNFCCC COP21/CMP11 - Establishment of South-South collaborative framework with Liberia for Biodiversity conservation in the common Protected Area at Gola - Development of SOP for District Disaster Management Committees

- Land Policy was approved by Cabinet in November 2015 - A Position Paper on NRM and environmental sustainability was submitted to the Constitutional Review Committee resulting in a new chapter in the Constitution on natural resource management as a national priority - The Natural Resource Charter Benchmarking Precepts was domesticated and is to form part of the National Mining Policy that is being developed - The National Position Paper was developed and SL participated in UNFCCC COP21/CMP11 - The NPAA and its Liberia counterpart signed a MOU on South-South collaboration for Biodiversity conservation in the common Protected Area at Gola - The SOP for District Disaster Management Committees was developed though not validated

- Development and endorsement of the Core Minerals Policy based on the African Mining version - Development of a 5-Year Roll Out Plan for Core Minerals Policy - Finalisation and publication of the State of Environment Report - Capacity building for centralised GIS database management and information dissemination - Facilitation of a dialogue platform for natural resource governance - Training of NPAA staff on forest landscape restoration - Nationwide popularisation on relevant provisions of the Disaster Risk Management Policy - Facilitate the strengthening of effective DRM response mechanisms

Support to Aid Coor & Poverty Reduction
independent political entity

title.narrative: Adaptive Capacity of Water Services to Climate Change

description.narrative: The project seeks to enhance the adaptive capacity of decision-makers in the public and private sector involved in water provision to plan for and respond to climate change risks on water resources

title.narrative: Adaptive Capacity of Water Services to Climate Change
Adaptive Capacity of Water Services to Climate Change
Adaptive Capacity of Water Services to Climate Change

description.narrative: The project seeks to enhance the adaptive capacity of decision-makers in the public and private sector involved in water provision to plan for and respond to climate change risks on water resources
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

- # of climate change resilience plan for Guma reservoir established - # of people accessing safe water supply services at projected climate change affected communities - % change of key decision-makers with limited knowledge of climate change impacts or adaptation responses - Number of strategic documents produced and used in tackling climate change issues in the country

comment.narrative: - No climate change adaptation concerns and actions mainstreamed within the Guma Reservoir Management process - Zero additional people provided with access to safe water supply services at projected climate change affected target communities - Baseline capacity assessment to be undertaken at project onset
Development of a climate change resilience plan for Guma reservoir
Consultancy notice for the development of a climate change resilience plan for Guma reservoir initiated

- Updated Water Point and Groundwater mapping tools to adapt them to new aspects of climate changes developments within pilot communities - Commission a climate change resilience plan and emergency contingency plan for the Guma Reservoir - Facilitate a dialogue platform between service providers and users - Construct the rooftop rainwater collection with reservoirs in MRW, Murray Town Hospital and EFA buildings - Build and implement innovation demonstrations on spring boxes improvement in 5 demonstration sites in Kambia and Freetown - Construct gravity fed water distribution mechanisms in one community in Pujehun - Provide water storage and treatment systems to at least 20 households in Kono and Kambia

title.narrative: Climate Information and Early Warning Systems

description.narrative: Strengthening climate information and early warning systems in Africa for climate resilient development and adaptation to climate change – Country: Sierra Leone

title.narrative: Climate Information and Early Warning Systems
Climate Information and Early Warning Systems

description.narrative: It increases the adaptive capacity of institutions and communities to respond to the impacts of climate change at all levels and strengthened adaptive capacity to reduce risks to climate-induced economic losses
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

- % national coverage of climate/weather and hydrological monitoring infrastructure - # of development frameworks that incorporate any EWS/CI products such as risk maps or climate change predictions into long-term planning - # of tailored climate products for specific sectors - # of market research survey on how household/national required early warning advisories, both supporting targeted weather/climate service delivery - # increase of certified meteorologist & 25 observers

comment.narrative: - 20 % national coverage for climate/weather monitoring - 0 development frameworks that incorporate any EWS/CI products such as risk maps or climate change predictions into long-term planning - 0 tailored climate products developed - 0 market research survey on how household/national required early warning advisories, both supporting targeted weather/climate service delivery - 2 certified professional meteorologist & 25 observers

- 1 market research survey on how household/national required early warning advisories, both supporting targeted weather/climate service delivery - 2 SLMD personnel enrolled to be trained as certified meteorologist

• Survey initiated on market research survey on how household/national required early warning advisories, both supporting targeted weather/climate service delivery
• 2 SLMD personnel enrolled and are been trained as certified meteorologist

- Procure and install (operationalization training) meteorological and hydrological monitoring equipment - Re-install AMESD-PUMA e-station and upgrade SYNERGY system to support tailored weather now-cast and forecast - Develop in-service and on-the-job capacity development programme for Met. Technicians - Provide the MWR, SLMD & ONS a reliable, direct and fast data and information communication system - Procure and install a Television and Radio Weather Broadcast equipment for forecast dissemination - Develop capacity programme in hydrological modeling and sector tailored hydrological forecasting techniques and information packaging - Establish & operationalise a Climate Change Data Management System - Establish CBEWS at Bumbuna Watershed, Guma Valley and IVS Farms in Eastern Districts under a “Cash-for-Work” scheme

title.narrative: UN SUPPORT TO SIERRA LEONE CONSTITUTIONAL REVIEW PROCESS

description.narrative: The Republic of Sierra Leone Constitutional Review Programme (2013-2015)

title.narrative: Sierra leone Constitutional Review programme Document 2013-2015

description.narrative: The Republic of Sierra Leone Constitutional Review Programme (2013-2015)
Elections - elections

# of staff Trained : Male ... Female % of trained staff (male/ female) satisfied with quality and usefulness of capacity development workshops % of CRC members (male/female) satisfied with quality and support provided by the secretariat staff # of Secretariat staff provided with induction training - Communication and messaging strategy developed # of newsletter produced Community radia station engaged in disseminating CRC's civic education & public consultation messages # of copies of constitution and report produced # and tyep of activities to engaged youth in review process organized # of youth (male/female) engaged in the process - type of national and sub national civic education campaigns organized # of coordination and consensus bulding workshops between CRC and CSO's organized # of public consultation forms published and disseminated # of inclusive constitutional dialogue with focus on peace bulding and nation building topic held # of MPs (male/female) trained on dialogue, mediation and confict resulation # of CRC members (male/female) exposure visit to boserve best constitutional practices.

comment.narrative: By Decemeber 31, a training feedback report shows that at least 80% of staff trained are satisfied with its quality and usefulness (data disaggregated by sex) 40 CRC staff trained by 31st December 2015 (male:female ratio) Very transparency processes leading to the drafting of the new CRC (Rating) - Effective civic education undertaken to build knowledge of constitutional reform (Rating) - Effective and inclusiveness of public consultation process undertaken - Civil education strategy developed and effective civic education undertake to build knowledge of constitutional issues in all 149 chiefdoms - Effective public consultation process undertaken to collect feedback from across the country - All information about CRC members, CRC process and planned activities are publically available online and proactively communicated to public - Media responsibly reporting on constitutional issues and drawing on factual information from CRC in their reporting - MPs, women and youth specifically capacitated to engage constitutional process - CSOs network is established and effectively participating in the consultation process, with CSO input into CR debate, monitoring CR process and supporting civic education in all regions of the country

Fourteen Experts Meetings were organized for all Sub-Committees on key constitutional and governance related issues concerning to their thematic areas. Workshop brought together a crop of legal experts and stakeholders who critically examined the legal framework of Sierra Leone, bordering the conduct of Referendum and made recommendations for inclusion for legal provisions. These experts also drafted a comprehensive referendum Bill which has been sent to the Ministry of Justice
CRC developed an inclusive civic education strategy and engaged country’s leading TV, radio and print media outlets to disseminate and educate general public on the thematic issues and review process. Eighteen community radio stations partnered with SLBC to simulcast SLBC thematic discussions and programs at national level.
Through open public consultation and establishment of “Constitution Kiosks” the public was able to fill out submission forms and have greater understanding of issues in the review process.

comment.narrative: - 5-30% efficient cook stoves technologies - No policies and legal frameworks supportive of BET applications - No certified sustainable charcoal production businesses developed - Zero installed efficient charcoal kiln, industrial stoves and institutional furnaces/stoves being used on a daily basis by households in targeted areas

- 3 policies and legal frameworks supportive of BET applications - 5 sustainable charcoal production businesses developed as influenced by the strengthened policy and institutional frameworks for BET application

description.narrative: Supporting the Government of Sierra Leone's Security Sector and EVD survivor's Livelihood

This project is intended to provide support to the Government of Sierra Leone's efforts in response to the Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) crisis, which has claimed the lives of 2,732 persons since it began.

This Project is intended to support the Government of Sierra Leone's Security Sector Institutions to be proactively responsive as they try to contain and eradicate the Ebola Outbreak that has claimed the lives of more than 3,000 Sierra Leoneans

description.narrative: The INDCs will be Sierra Leone’s mechanism to address its ambition for reducing emissions within the context of its national circumstances and south-south support framework
The INDC will be Sierra Leone’s mechanism to address its ambition for reducing emissions within the context of its national circumstances and south-south support framework.

• # Stakeholder discussions held • # of INDC document submitted • Consultant hired • # of validation workshop held on road map for implementation of the INDC • # of stakeholder meetings held to developed an integrated programme • Consultant hired to developed nationally appropriate mitigation action. • # of regional workshop on nationally appropriate mitigation action developed. • Draft mitigation document validated • # of sensitization at both national and community level. • # of brochures and newsletters produced • consultant hired to develop response programme from the National Climate Change Strategy and Action Programme (NCCS&AP)

comment.narrative: • Draft Climate Change Policy (CCP) developed • National Climate Change Strategy and Action Plan (NCCS&AP) developed with clear priority programmes on adaptation and mitigation. • Climate Change Mainstreaming guidelines developed and capacity of institutions enhanced for smooth implementation. • Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDCs) developed and submitted to the UNFCCC secretariat as part of Sierra Leone contributions before the Paris Conference (COP21).

• INDC approved by Cabinet • INDC issues promoted among stakeholders • Consultant hired to developed road map • Road map validated • Integrated programme developed for funding • Nationally appropriate mitigation action document produced • Draft document on mitigation validated by stakeholders • Sensitization on climate change related issues held at national and community level • Brochures and newsletter produced • Response programme expanded from the National Climate Change Strategy and Action Plan
